description.narrative: The proposed emergency HIV/AIDS Multi-Sectoral Project aims at supporting the government response to the pandemic by: (a) Strengthened access to and increased utilization of prevention services among vulnerable and high risk groups (such as women, youth, commercial sex workers, personnel of line ministries); (b) Improved access and utilization of treatment and care services for HIV/AIDS infected and affected persons, notably the persons living with HIV/AIDS (including PLWHA and OVC).

condition.narrative: Carry out 2 technical audits, of the Project and any Subprojects, respectively, each covering 1 fiscal year of the Recipient
Financial audit during 1st year of Project carried out semi-annually and to be furnished to IDA within 3 months of each such period
Recruitment of financial auditors within 4 months of effectiveness
Recruitment of technical auditors within 4 months of effectiveness
copies of the technical audit reports shall be made available to the Association no later than three (3) months after the end ofeac h such period; and

title.narrative: Percentage and number of high risk groups (FSW) who received an HIV test in the last 12 months and who came back for their test results

comment.narrative: Source: Project. The percentage is 99.68%; 12151 FSWs have been tested.

title.narrative: Percentage of people from at risk-groups who both correctly identify ways of preventing sexual transmission of HIV and who reject major misconceptions about HIV transmission .

comment.narrative: Source: Behavioral Survey in the project Zone-National Institute for statistics (INS).The project surpassed its target and thisindicator will not change because no new data is expected.

title.narrative: Number of condoms distributed (male & female) among the CSW in the 4 target Project regions.

comment.narrative: Source: Project. The project purchased in total 4,936,800 condoms (male and female) because PEPFAR and UNFPA also are distributingcondoms amongst the same Group. The project distributed 3,244,193 to NGOs and the distribution to CSW is in process. The indicatorwill beimproved at closing but the target will not be achieved.

title.narrative: Percentage and number of adults and children with advanced HIV infection receiving antiretroviral therapy [disaggregated by sex andage (<15, 15+)] - (UNGASS, UA, AAP)

comment.narrative: Source: PNPEC (Programme National Prise En Charge).This indicator surpassed its target.

title.narrative: Percentage and number of HIV-infected pregnant women who received a completed antiretroviral treatment to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission (UNGASS, UA, AAP)

comment.narrative: Source: Programme National de Prise En Charge (PNPEC).This indicator will not be achieved due to the quality of health services,the project being a partner of last resort working on difficult sites and the political crisis with most of health centers being inthe conflict zone .
Souce project: No new training has taken placeIDA 15 indicators

title.narrative: % of women and men from 15-49 years of age having had more than 1 sexual partner in the preceding 12 months reporting condom use during their last sexual intercourse;

comment.narrative: Source: Behavioral Survey in the project Zone-National Institute for statistics (INS)

title.narrative: Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who received an HIV test in the last 12 months and who came back for their test results.

comment.narrative: Source : projectThis indicator is above its target.

title.narrative: Percentage of executing agencies (public sector and civil society) that submit programmatic and financial three-monthly reports completed and on schedule

comment.narrative: Source: Project.This indicator is progressing may change at project closing with an achievement rate estimated at 84%.

title.narrative: % of female sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client (disaggregated by age (<25, 25+>) (UNGASS, AAP)

comment.narrative: National survey on female sex workers behavior. ENSEA

title.narrative: Number of decentralized ( department) plans developed and implemented in the four regions for Health and Education

comment.narrative: Source: Project. This indicator will not change because all the 24 departments are covered, 16 by the project and 8 byPEPFAR&Global FUND.

title.narrative: Number of sub-contracts awarded and implemented for HRG and vulnerable populations

target.value: At least 51 have been implemented (per year)

comment.narrative: Source: ProjectThis indicator surpassed its target and will not change.First year 74 contracts were signed and each additionalyear 81 contracts were signed

title.narrative: Percentage and number of CTAIL put in place and operational

comment.narrative: The CTAILs have been suppressed from the Ministry of Health new institutional arrangement. Before the suppression, out 19 CTAIL tobe installed by the Government, 13 have been installed and out them the project has supported 6 while others have been supportedbythe Government and PEPFAR

title.narrative: Joint annual report of the Multisectoral HIV/AIDS Program, disseminated during the annual Meeting of the CNLS.

comment.narrative: Source: Project. The annual report has been prepared each year but the national council met only once. The fourth reports isunderpreparation.
